required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Sores Treatment by Oxygenotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Sores Treatment by Oxygenotherapy

brief_summary.textblock:
Patient with chronic wounds are selected to receive NATROX system ; it's a continous diffusion of oxygen therapy delivery system. This one is put on the wound during a consultation at the hospital and will be followed in home medical care. Every 2 days a nurse renew the application at home and patient recharge the system with oxygen every day.
The complete treatment is prescribe for 4 weeks and at the end patient comes to hospital to have a consultation with the doctor.

primary_outcome.measure: number of patients received the entire treatment (3 to 4 weeks of oxygenotherapy) in home medical care
primary_outcome.description: Patients who have received the entire treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: percentage of patients who can receive skin graft after the therapy
secondary_outcome.description: patient eligible to skin graft after the therapy indicate the success of the NATROX system

secondary_outcome.measure: percentage of patient who stopper the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: number of patients who have to stop the treatment because of non tolerability among all included patient

arm_group.description: Each patient included receive the experimental device system NATROX during 3 to 4 weeks

intervention.description: system NATROX (device name) application on the wounds of lower limbs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 18 years
- accepted to participate
- Patients followed in vascular medicine and entrusted to the home medical care for the bandages of chronic wounds with apathetic ulcers, not presenting of granulation tissue on their surface
Exclusion Criteria:
- infected ulcers
- necrosed ulcers
- Arterial ulcers requiring a revascularisation.
- Ulcers whose surface is superior in 10x10 cm.
